body_html:
You're right that my tf.squeeze suggestion does not work, because there is no path from the tf.squeeze tensor to y.

(3) is quite clever. I do not know Keras so I do not know what the problem is. @fchollet, do you know how to resolve (3)? @iramusa, you can also ask on StackOverflow to get help with (3).

Marking as contributions welcome if anyone wants to add support for effectively 1D Tensors to tf.hessians.

You're right that my tf.squeeze suggestion does not work, because there is no path from the tf.squeeze tensor to y.
(3) is quite clever. I do not know Keras so I do not know what the problem is. @fchollet, do you know how to resolve (3)? @iramusa, you can also ask on StackOverflow to get help with (3).
Marking as contributions welcome if anyone wants to add support for effectively 1D Tensors to tf.hessians.
body:
You're right that my `tf.squeeze` suggestion does not work, because there is no path from the `tf.squeeze` tensor to `y`. 

(3) is quite clever. I do not know Keras so I do not know what the problem is. @fchollet, do you know how to resolve (3)? @iramusa, you can also ask on StackOverflow to get help with (3).

Marking as contributions welcome if anyone wants to add support for effectively 1D Tensors to `tf.hessians`.
